I need your opinion and suggestion. We are currently working on a project where we are using Laravel. The client has their own database where they input information or new products. Our Laravel application enables these data to be transferred to our HubDB on the HubSpot platform and displayed on a dynamic page within our HubSpot application.
However, we want to simplify this process by creating a more efficient and straightforward API, completely removing the Laravel platform. In this case, would you recommend using Firebase or Xano? The key requirement is that the data should automatically appear in our HubDB, and any changes the client makes in their database should be immediately synchronized and reflected on our side.

However, I can't find a way to retrieve the comments made on these notes. I've tried:

1. Looking in the engagement response data
→ No comments data present

2. Using the comments v3 endpoint:
GET <https://api.hubapi.com/comments/v3/objects/tickets/{ticketId}/comments>
→ Returns 404

3. Using the conversations endpoint:
GET <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/conversations/v3/conversations/thread/ticket/{ticketId}>
→ Returns 404

Could someone please guide me on:
- What's the correct endpoint to retrieve comments made on notes?
- Is there any specific authentication or permission needed?
- Is there documentation available for this specific use case?

Thanks in advance! :pray:

Hi all,
I’m currently using the Custom Channels (Beta) API to integrate eBay messages into HubSpot. The issue is that eBay never includes the customer’s email or phone number—only an eBay ID. Because of this, I created a custom property in HubSpot contacts called “Ebay ID,” and whenever I receive a message from eBay, I use that eBay ID to create or update a contact in HubSpot.
When sending the message to HubSpot, I set:
```json


"deliveryIdentifier": {
  "type": "CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID",
  "value": "<eBay ID>"
}```
However, HubSpot isn’t automatically matching these conversations with the existing contact who has the same “Ebay ID” value.
Could you please let me know how I can *automatically* associate a conversation with the correct contact in my custom channel? I’ve tried multiple approaches through the API, but none have been successful so far. Any guidance or best practices for this scenario would be extremely helpful.
Thank you in advance for your support!

Hey <@U088F2S9T5M> I am not sure about the technical parts of what you are doing but just wondering if your "Ebay ID" property is set to unique in HubSpot. You know you can set it only when creating a property by ticking the "require unique values" checkbox.
If you did not tick that HubSpot does not know the property is unique so it will duplicate contacts

Hey <@U04CC57CMBP>.
No, my property doesn’t have that value set to “unique.” Do you think that might be the problem and that I should recreate the field with the uniqueness requirement enabled?

Hi <@U07903Z5YRG> :wave:
Yes, this is possible -- you just need to set the Meetings property "HubSpot_owner_id" accordingly. To find the relevant ID, you can retrieve a list of all HubSpot Owners:
```curl --location '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/owners>' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer pat-redacted'```
The HubSpot Owner ID is the "id" attribute, supplied per response result.
That most likely is the issue. Give it a go, nothing to lose :slightly_smiling_face:

You could also just use a workflow to copy any values from the old property into the new one.
Any non-unique contacts will error out. You can catch them in a static list as duplicates.
I have done that a few times
